title: Nenad Đurović
text:
Nenad Đurović (<a href="Cyrillic">Cyrillic</a>: Ненад Ђуpoвић, born 17 January 1986) is a <a href="Montenegrins%20%28ethnic%20group%29">Montenegrin</a> retired <a href="Association%20football">football</a> defender who mostly played for <a href="FK%20Sutjeska%20Nik%C5%A1i%C4%87">Sutjeska Nikšić</a>.
Club career.
The first club for which he played for was <a href="FK%20Sutjeska%20Nik%C5%A1i%C4%87">FK Sutjeska Nikšić</a> from his hometown. He was eventually traded to <a href="FK%20Zeta">FK Zeta</a> and played with that team until he made his first career move to a foreign club by signing with <a href="FC%20Spartak%20Trnava">Spartak Trnava</a> in January 2008. He played again with <a href="FK%20Zeta">FK Zeta</a> before signing with <a href="FK%20In%C4%91ija">FK Inđija</a> that finished top in the <a href="Serbian%20First%20League">Serbian First League</a> achieving promotion to the <a href="Serbian%20SuperLiga">Serbian SuperLiga</a>. After playing the first half of the 2010–11 season in Serbia, he moved at winter break to Hungary and signed with <a href="Szolnoki%20MAV%20FC">Szolnoki MAV FC</a>. In January 2012, after a half season spent with <a href="FC%20Petrolul%20Ploie%C5%9Fti">FC Petrolul Ploieşti</a> in Romanian <a href="Liga%20I">Liga I</a>, he returned to <a href="FK%20Sutjeska%20Nik%C5%A1i%C4%87">FK Sutjeska Nikšić</a> playing now in the <a href="Montenegrin%20First%20League">Montenegrin First League</a>.
He was part of the <a href="Serbia%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">Serbia and Montenegro under-19</a> team at the <a href="2005%20UEFA%20European%20Under-19%20Football%20Championship">2005 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship</a>. He also played for the <a href="Montenegro%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Montenegrin under-21 team</a>.
